name: Grindale House

reviews.text: Stayed here for one night on business. The room was lovely, tastefully decorated, warm, spotlessly clean and a very comfy bed! Bonus was the superb breakfast! Full English for me but lots of choice if you prefer continental style. Landlady very helpfull. I can't recommend this place enough.
reviews.title: Excellent!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stopped here again this New Year. Wasn't going to as was looking for a change but after a year of traumas couldn't be bothered to research somewhere else and returned to what we knew would be excellent. The only downside this time was that the couple in the room above us was as light on their feet as a herd of elephants and made a racket when they went to bed and several times in the night when I assume they paid a visit. Fortunately they checked out on New Years Day so we managed a good night's sleep before we left on the 2nd. Obviously Valerie could not help that so don't let that put you off as on the previous visit we were in exactly the same room and never heard a thing and we are sure that it was fully booked so there would have been someone up there.
reviews.title: Another excellent New Year

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arrived 5pm Sunday , had booked 3 nights thru Late Rooms. They had no record of tbooking. Val was out for the day. Her son-in-law was brilliant, assured us that he could give us a room and Val would sort it out on return. We were shown to a non advertised lovely bedroom but no en suite, bathroom across landing for our sole use.We took it
reviews.title: Disaster avoided

reviews.text: Saw Val at breakfast next day she offered us various choices and a discount on the bill.We actually ended up staying in 3 different rooms(our choice) so this is a comprehensive review. Family suite excellent for mature or young families. Outside room has cottage feel.Breakfast very good ,waitress charming in a typical Yorkshire way. All rooms spotless and Val and her family absolutely charming.
reviews.title: Lovely!

reviews.text: What can I say, Grindale house is an excellent BnB. Rooms are superbly decorated. For once, a really comfy bed, and pillows. I've not slept that well away from home in a long while. Everything spotlessly clean.
reviews.title: Returning visits-a must stay!

reviews.text: I booked into Grindale House with my 82 year old Mum and 79 year old Aunt visiting from the USA. We stayed in ground floor accommodation off the courtyard and the rooms were perfect. Exceptionally clean,very tastefully furnished and extremely comfortable. Valerie and her staff were so friendly and welcoming and the breakfasts were magnificent.
reviews.title: October 2 day break

reviews.text: We had fantastic weather for our stay and we all agreed we would recommend Grindale House to anyone.
reviews.title: We've stayed there three years running!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am well known in the family for being a bit fussy, but I really couldn't fault Grindale House at all and the whole trip was fantastic. Well done to Grindale House and the team - A+!!
reviews.title: Lovely Place to Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For the last three years, we have spent a week in late August in Rose Barn, one of the two very comfortable and well-equipped cottages at Grindale House, after a hectic week doing the Edinburgh Fringe. We have returned each year because Grindale House is a lovely and restful place to stay! The location is peaceful but central, with everything one could need in the way of shops and amenities just a short walk away. Rose Barn is amazingly quiet and well sound-proofed; the people in the next cottage had small children but we would never have known had we not seen them get into their car. The beds, sofas and showers in the cottage were excellent and the whole place spotless. Pickering is a delightful town and a perfect base for exploring the North Yorkshire Moors, with lots of additional attractions such as Castle Howard, Eden Camp, Rievaulx, Ampleforth, etc., nearby. We're not going north in 2012 but if we were, we'd definitely stay at Grindale House for a fourth time.
reviews.title: Lovely B and B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Grindale House is a lovely B&B! We checked Trip Advisor before making a booking as we wanted to stay somewhere with value for money and that other people had found comfortable.
reviews.title: Suited us to a T!

reviews.text: We stayed for one night only but it is certain we shall return.
reviews.title: "Can't wait to return"

reviews.text: The hotel was wonderful, the staff very friendly and the breakfast was suberb.
reviews.title: Lovely b&b great location

reviews.text: Room was spotless and every facility was afforded to my husband & myself
reviews.title: The best B&B by far

reviews.text: Car parking was no problem at all.
reviews.title: Home from home, Quality B&B

reviews.text: Well done to all.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay

reviews.text: We stayed for 2 nights in the family suite; two rooms and a sitting room all to ourselves, fantastic! Everything was spotless, the breakfast was wonderful and the staff were friendly and helpful. A great base for a family break to North Yorkshire, I would definately go back and will recommend to all my friends and family!
reviews.title: Fantastic B and B - great for a family break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ideally located on the Eastgate, just on the periphery of Pickering town centre, Grindale House makes an ideal base for exploring Pickering on foot for shopping during the day or sampling one of the multitude of restaurants of an evening. The main entrance is on the Eastgate (on foot only), whilst vehicular access is to the rear, through a seriously small gap between two terraced houses, requires absolute concentration! This leads into a spacious gravelled car park surrounded by pleasant gardens. Grindale House has several self-catering lets, as well as the majority of bed and breakfast accommodation. As we arrived we were met by the friendly owner who served us a cup of tea and a biscuit in the resident's lounge, after our long drive - a nice touch. The lounge had fantastically comfortable leather sofas, a large flat-screen TV and resident's guide recommending places to eat and visit.
reviews.title: A great base for exploring the local area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After ascending some rather precipitous stairs, our room was modern in décor and tastefully furnished, a little compact perhaps, but with good facilities - tea and coffee making facilities, HDTV etc. The bathroom had underfloor heating, very nice in the winter! A couple of minor niggles, the mattress on the bed was firm to put it mildly, that led to a few broken night’s sleep, good for posture perhaps, but difficult to sleep on. The second was the curtains on the small waist height window that looked out onto the courtyard. They covered the window and the whole of the small radiator, blocking out the only source of heat in the room, easily remedied though by folding the curtain or having shorter curtains!
reviews.title: Lovely building in a good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast room doorway and many entrances throughout Grindale House have low beams, courtesy of the age of the building. Forgot to duck low enough a few times! The breakfast room was modern in feel and felt spacious when the guest house was partially full, but quite cramped when it approached full occupancy later in the week. Breakfast wise, there was a good range of fruit juices, cereals, fresh fruit etc. The Full English was great, perfectly cooked and full of flavour, the smoked salmon and scrambled eggs strangely bland and the pancakes just right. It was a priceless moment though when both my wife and I ordered the pancakes on the same morning, a rare request I think!
reviews.title: Great B & B , lovely rooms , excellent breakfasts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed just one night, room was lovely and clean albeit a bit small (but it is a very old building), there is parking around the back and breakfast was very nice. All in all a nice stay but would say £80 is a bit expensive I would say it was more of a £55-£65 a night B&B. Good location within minutes walk of Pickering centre
reviews.title: A friendly and accommodating B&B

description: Grindale House, Four Star Gold Award, Bed and breakfast Accommodation centrally located in Pickering, North Yorkshire. Ideally located just 5 minutes walk to the market place, North Yorkshire Moors Railway Station and a variety of surrounding attractions including the North Yorkshire Moors and Yorkshire Coast.
